result.execSummary:
The defendant Yizreel Y. Tate was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: ***DEFT IS TO REPORT TO P&P ON 7-24-17 IN THE MORNING. ***

miscConds.notes:
If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
-****
***Bond applied  -  PAID IN FULL ON ALL COUNTS ***

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
DOC shall promptly notify the court, in writing, of any new or criminal charge made against the deft.  Contact w/ wife is up to Domestic Relations Court.  If no order in FCC court, then contact up to agent.

timeConds.notes: Deft is NOT to be released on huber/work release during his jail sentence.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Christopher Rose.  Arguments heard on deft's motion for huber release.  At this time, the Court's order of no huber release shall continue.  State has until 8/29/17 by the close of business to provide documents which substantiate the claims/investigation against the deft.  If the claims are not substantiated, the Court is inclined to reinstate the deft's huber privileges on Wed, August 30th.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person.  Appellate counsel Colleen Marion appeared via telephone.  Atty Marion reports she has closed her file; there is nothing active in the Court of Appeals at this time.  Deft reports he has retained private counsel - provided a copy of a retainer agreement.  However, there is no signature from a representative on the retainer agreement.  Copy of retainer agreement provided to the Court.  Court orders the deft to report to Probation & Parole on 7/24/17 in the morning and to report to the jail by noon on 7/24/17.  Once the deft is in custody, the appeal bond may be returned to poster.

Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Donald Bielski.  Victim rights compliance.  Victim present; victim statement made.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for two years on each count concurrent.  See conditions.  Deft given 6mos KCJ as a condition of probation on count 1; deft taken into custody.  DNA ordered; notice given to deft.  Appeal rights.   

Atty Bielski argues for bond pending appeal; Atty Bielski reports he will be filing an appeal this afternoon.  State objects.  Court sets bond @ $10,000 cash on each count 1 & count 2.  Bond set @ $1,000 cash on count 3.  Deft's present bond may be applied towards his bond pending appeal.
from ADA Jesssica Krejcarek re: update regarding contact between the deft and T.T.

** MODIFIED**
** PRESENT BOND MAY BE USED TO OFFSET THE AMOUNT- DEFT NEEDS TO POST AN ADDITIONAL $4,000 CASH.***

940.19(1) - Battery DV  /  940.44(1) - Misd intimidation of a victim DV  /  947.01(1) - DC DV

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Donald Bielski.  Case is now resolved.  Deft will plead guilty to all three counts and the State agrees not to charge the deft with bail jumping charges.  Deft pleads guilty to all three counts; found guilty by the Court.  Sentencing hrg set for 6/13/16 @ 2:30pm.  Court amends the deft's bond to $7,000 cash total - same conditions.  Present bond may be used to offset the amount - deft needs to post an additional $4,000 cash.  If bond is posted, deft shall be under house arrest - only exception will be directly to/from work.  Deft taken into custody
Juror Selection & Peremptory Challenges

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Donald Bielski.  Deft wishes to have new counsel.  Discussion held.  Court not inclined to grant an adjournment unless the deft wishes to retain new counsel.  Court takes a short recess.  Court reconvenes.  Same appearances including - Atty Scott Wales appeared via telephone.  Atty Wales reports he did have contact from the deft this past Friday or Saturday, but the deft has not retained him to date.  Court will not adjourn the trial.  JS commences at 10:40am.  Jury selected @ 11:44am.  Unselected jurors released for the day forthwith.  Preliminary instructions given to the selected jurors.  Jurors released @ 12:01pm; instructed to return @ 9am on 5/24/16.

Deft demands jury trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 9, 2015 at 01:45 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 10:20 am.  Jury selection scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.  $5000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  Atty. Edwards requests dismissal of complaint; denied.
